questionText: A diver jumps from a 10-meter high platform. The height of the diver, <math><mi>h</mi></math>, in meters, above the water <math><mi>t</mi></math> seconds after jumping is modeled by the equation <math><mi>h</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4.9</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. What is the height of the diver, in meters, after 1.5 seconds?
solutionText: To find the height of the diver after 1.5 seconds, we need to evaluate the function <math><mi>h</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></math> at <math><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn></math>. We substitute 1.5 for <math><mi>t</mi></math> in the equation: <math display='block'><mi>h</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4.9</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1.5</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math><math display='block'><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4.9</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2.25</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math><math display='block'><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>11.025</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>22</mn></math><math display='block'><mo>=</mo><mn>10.975</mn></math> Thus, the height of the diver after 1.5 seconds is 10.975 meters.
